resources.string:
Version %2$s, %1$s
Start again to update to version %3$s
Start by connecting to a computer
For devices without root, you need to use adb to start Shizuku (requires computer connection). This process needs to be repeated every time the device is restarted. Please read the help.

%1$s

* There are some other considerations, please confirm that you have read the help first.

On Android 11 or above, you can enable Wireless debugging and start Shizuku directly from your device, without connecting to a computer.

Please view the step-by-step guide first.
Before Android 11, connecting to a computer is required to enable Wireless debugging.

Please enable \"Wireless debugging\" in \"Developer options\". \"Wireless debugging\" is automatically disabled when network changes.\n\nNote, do not disable \"Developer options\" or \"USB debugging\", or Shizuku will be stopped.
Please try to disable and enable \"Wireless debugging\" if it keeps searching.
Port is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.
Can\'t connect to wireless debugging service.\n\nPlease ensure that Shizuku is whitelisted in all firewall, ad-block, VPN, or similar apps that can restrict network access.
Wireless debugging is not enabled.\nNote, before Android 11, to enable wireless debugging, computer connection is a must.
USB debugging is not enabled.\nPlease enable it in \"Developer Options\".

Please start pairing by performing the following steps:
- Navigate to "Developer Options"
- Enable "USB debugging" and "Wireless debugging"
- Tap the left side of "Wireless debugging"
- Tap "Pair device with pairing code"
- Input the pairing code in the notification

On Android 14, installing/updating Shizuku with the Package Installer revokes the ^1 permission, which is required to enable the accessibility service for pairing.

To grant it, run the following ADB command:

^2

After running the command, you may continue with the pairing process.

Note: you can bypass this by installing/updating Shizuku with ADB.

Please enable the accessibility service to start the pairing process. This allows Shizuku to detect the pairing code.\n\nThe accessibility service will be turned off when the code is found or after 1 minute to save energy.

Please start pairing by performing the following steps:
- Navigate to "Developer Options"
- Enable "USB debugging" and "Wireless debugging"
- Tap the left side of "Wireless debugging"
- Tap "Pair device with pairing code." Shizuku will automatically detect the pairing code.
The system requires the pairing dialog to always be visible. Using split-screen mode is the only way to let this app and the system dialog be visible at the same time.
Unable to generate key for wireless debugging.\nThis may be because the KeyStore mechanism of this device is broken.
Failed to stop ADB over TCP
Please go through the pairing step first.
A notification from Shizuku will help you complete the pairing.
Navigate to \"Developer Options\", then enable \"USB debugging\" and \"Wireless debugging\".
Tap the left side of \"Wireless debugging\", then tap \"Pair device with pairing code.\" Enter the code in the notification to complete pairing.
The pairing process needs you to interact with a notification from Shizuku. Please allow Shizuku to post notifications.
MIUI users may need to switch notification style to \"Android\" from \"Notification\" - \"Notification shade\" in system settings.
Otherwise, you may not able to enter the pairing code from the notification.
Go back to Shizuku and start Shizuku.
Shizuku needs to access the local network. It is controlled by the network permission.

Some systems (such as MIUI) disallow apps to access the network when they are not visible, even if the app uses a foreground service. Please disable battery optimization features for Shizuku on such systems.
If you are using Magisk, you can try %1$s. For root users, it will eventually replace Shizuku. Note, existing applications need to change a little to use %2$s.
Apps that have requested or declared the Shizuku permission will show here.
Apps like Tasker and MacroDroid can send intents to start/stop Shizuku automatically.
To use the start intent on your device, you first need to enable ADB over TCP by running %1$s from a PC.
You will need to reconfigure your intents with the new token.
Learn how to develop with Shizuku
You need to take an extra step

Your device manufacturer has restricted adb permissions and apps using Shizuku will not work properly.

Usually, this limitation can be lifted by adjusting some options in "Developer options". Please read the help for details on how to do this.

You may need to restart Shizuku for the operation to take effect.
The permission of adb is limited

It\'s highly possible that your device manufacturer limits the permission of adb.

There may be a solution for your system in this document.
Run shell commands in terminal apps through Shizuku
Users have reported that MIUI breaks the Storage Access Framework, which is used by the export function.
If you are using MIUI, you may have to extract the file from the assets folder in Shizuku\'s APK.
Export the files to a new folder.
Two files will be exported: %1$s and %2$s. If the files already exist in the selected folder, they will be deleted.
Use your terminal app to copy the files to its private files directory.

Tip: If your terminal app\'s home directory (~) is in the private files directory, placing the files there will allow you to run %1$s without writing the path.\n\nOtherwise, you can create an alias for %2$s in your terminal app\'s %3$s configuration file.
Open a shell with the following command:

With %1$s, you can run shell commands in any terminal app.

Tap to learn more about how to use it.
Choose which actions appear when you long-press an app in the management list. If only one is enabled it triggers directly — no menu shown.
An enhanced Shizuku with powerful app management features. Swipe gestures, quick actions, and customizable experiences — all in one place.
By default, in the app management list, swipe right to open an app or swipe left to view its system settings page.
You can fully customize these swipe actions in Settings. Choose from Open App, App Info, Toggle Permission, or Hide from List.
Choose which actions appear when you long-press an app, or enable Shizuku+ exclusive features like Dhizuku Mode.
Choose how to start Shizuku on this device. You can also do this later from the main screen.
Android 11+, no computer needed. Uses wireless debugging.
Your device is rooted. Start Shizuku with root access.
Any device. Run one ADB command from a computer to get started.

Due to a bug in Android 11-12, wireless debugging does not remember any authorized networks.\n\nYou will need to re-authorize the network on each reboot by tapping \"Allow\" when the authorization dialog pops up.
Automatically restart Shizuku if it crashes
"Allows Shizuku to restart without Wi-Fi. (Shizuku must have started once since reboot)"
"The TCP port will be closed immediately. You will need Wi-Fi to turn on TCP mode again. Continue?"
Shizuku needs to restart in order to apply this setting.
Wi-Fi is required. Shizuku will continue running and wait for a Wi-Fi connection before restarting in the background.
Disable USB debugging when stopping Shizuku
Help us translate %s into your language
Use the pure black theme if night mode is enabled
Show activity log on home screen
Enter the pairing code in a dialog instead of a notification
Share Device Owner (DevicePolicyManager) permissions with other apps
Enable extended features like automatic reconnection and Kotlin Coroutines support for client apps
Check that you are using the ^1.
Read the ^1 and follow all relevant troubleshooting steps.
Search through all ^1 to see if your bug has already been reported.
Please submit an issue on ^1 if you have an account.
Otherwise, you can send an email.
Having trouble starting Shizuku? Tap to run a diagnostic check.
Battery optimization must be disabled for start on boot/watchdog to work properly.
Please disable battery optimization to use this feature.
Shizuku is already starting in the background
This service is only supported on TV devices
You can start Shizuku service now.
Add the “auth” extra to your intent. You can find your token by tapping “View intents” in the app.
Make sure the token in your intent matches the one shown under “View intents” in the app.
Allow the app to use Shizuku.
Can\'t start service because root permission is not granted or this device is not rooted.
Shizuku needs WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS to start on boot. Tap to learn how to grant it.
Watchdog restarted the service. Tap to learn about potential fixes to prevent future crashes.

Provides pairing support for devices (e.g., TVs running Android 14+) where notifications or split screen cannot be used.\n\nEnables Shizuku to extract the pairing code from the wireless debugging pairing screen. It will disable itself once the pairing code is found.

Legacy Shizuku has been deprecated since March 2019. Also, legacy Shizuku does not work on newer Android systems.

Please ask the developer of %1$s to update.

%1$s has modern Shizuku support, but it\'s requesting legacy Shizuku. This could because Shizuku is not running, please check in Shizuku app.

Legacy Shizuku has been deprecated since March 2019.
